comment: i took her for freshman honors seminar. she just irked me. sweet at times but i never felt like she was genuine. txtbook content made me want to cry because it was SO DRY. in class discussions did not help with just how boring the content was. also she would often reference her non-honors classes & call them lazy which was not cool. she annoyed me.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I took this class because I needed a 1 credit hour class and it was honestly the best decision. Prof Lynn is hilarious and caring. she really knows her stuff. She made the class fun and we did a bunch of partner exercises. There are 2 skills tests, a midterm, and a final. Overall a pretty fun class. She is truly a sweetheart!

I took this class really hoping to learn some solid self defense moves and techniques. While you don't learn anything crazy, you do learn the basics that really go a long way. You learn actual moves and prevention tips in the 2 lectures. Prof. Lynn is amazing. You can tell she really cares about teaching us how to keep ourselves safe. Def recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. The feedback she gives on assignments is thorough and shows that she actually cares about how you're doing in school/life. The tests can be tricky. They're mostly multiple choice but created by a test bank that includes some trick questions. She's very accessible and helpful, actually wants us to succeed.

since she is an author of the book she makes you work 3 times more than other classes, you have to do voluntary work by Kennesaw website and have to go to 4 events which is stupid if you live an hour away and have to drive all the way for 30 min event

She is a very nice lady but made an 1101 freshman level class too burdensome. A lot of graded assignments. Make sure to keep track of the assignments and turn on your D2L notifications. I believe her class is too over the top. It is about learning how to do well in college but she will unnecessarily tank your GPA.

Professor Lynn is the most caring professor Ive met. There are more assignments then other professors teaching this class Ive been told, but nonetheless she is extremely caring and helpful. She wants us all to succeed, and her enthusiasm in the class was a huge plus to making the class super enjoyable. Id highly recommend taking her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Cool teacher, some content is common sense but some helpful. decent amount of work, nothing crazy though. I thought she was nice and generous and understanding on late or missed assignments.

This class. This was the most pointless class I've ever had and Professor Lynn made it 1000X harder than it needed to be. She was the editor of the textbook, so it it used for every quiz! Read! Late work is rarely accepted, but she will work with you. She gets very off topic and is rude. If you have the chance to get another professor, do it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is the editor of the textbook so everything is about the textbook. Really enthusiastic about self defense so that's what she talks about half the time. Pretty easy class, quite boring. You will not pass the five quizzes throughout the semester if you do not read the chapters before.

You only have a midterm and a final, which are really hard. Along with a thousand other assignments. She does not take late work. There are quizzes that are online, but you only have 1 minute per question and can't return to any of them. If you have the chance to take someone else, do it. If not, she's not impossible, but get ready for busy work.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Even though class discussion would get way off topic, I loved how everyone was always so engaged, she makes it easy to pass, just read for the quizzes and come to class. Me and a lot of my classmates did terrible on the midterm (only because we didn't study) and I still came out with an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Took this class as a hybrid. GET THE TEXTBOOK because there will be pointless and hard quizzes every week, in which you only get 10 minutes. Ms. Lynn is nice and caring, however during class she would always get off topic. The projects and papers in this class are ridiculous and time consuming. She is also a pretty tough grader. Lots of work
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This class was so much harder than it should have been. She gave so much busy work and her midterm is impossible. Almost everyone failed. She is a very hard grader. This was probably my hardest class. I made a C in the class, but all A's in my other classes if that tells you anything. She gives out way too many useless assignments.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Lynn is very sweet and caring however the work she gives is ridiculous. Tons of work all the time, she takes attendance every day.  My other classes are easier than this one. There are projects, papers, and group projects

Professor Lynn is not the worst professor ever, however.. Be prepared to work in this class. She takes attendance, and in my opinion she asks too much for too much work for a simple KSU 1101 class. If you email her asking to extend something, she is extremely rude and will not work with you. I do not recommend.

Professor Lynn is one of the sweetest professors i have. She truly cares about her students and how they're doing. I emailed her on my absence letting her know i was sick and she genuinely cared about how i was doing. The class can be somewhat challenging if you don't pay attention in class or if you have a hybrid because she is very very good at d2l. Sometimes, it's hard to find the assignments.

Professor Lynn is amazing!! I took her for self defense and I learned SO MUCH. Plus, you will basically get an A if you just show up and participate. All of the grades were easy A's. She's super nice, funny, and helpful. You actually learn stuff that can be useful for anyone and the lectures were amazing!! I would recommend this class to everyone!!

I took this class as part of a Learning Community and I got a B but I had to work for it.  There are timed quizzes online that are difficult & there is a 75 question mid term.  Final was easy.  There is a research paper on a career & she was very helpful to read over my paper & help me.  Don't expect this to be an easy A.   I never missed a class

Professor Lynn is a great teacher! and a very nice person. She does assign a lot of work, but most of it is very simple and not very time consuming.  The Midterm is crazy hard yes! The final is easy! The Quizzes that are from the textbook are very difficult.  There are a few Projects as well that weren't hard just time consuming.

She is such a sweet woman and very understanding, but as a freshman seminar class, this was very hard. I do all of the work that is asked and have still managed to have a bad grade. Her midterm is crazy hard and so unnecessary.
Stupid busy work.

I don't usually write these but, professor Lynn is the nicest teacher I've ever had. She's extremely helpful and knowledgable as she wrote the university wide Textbook. Dont expect an automatic A but if you try and stay organized its really easy. Just turn the work on time but If you have a personal emergency  she is extremely understanding.

She makes things way harder than they need to be and makes her class purposefully hard. Even bragged in class one day that 70% of her students fail the midterm (1 of 2 tests). Quizzes are all about the tiny details you won't remember from the chapters of reading and you only have 10 minutes for 10 questions.

Professor Lynn is a great teacher for the KSU 1101 seminar course. She genuinely cares about her students and makes the class easy to follow and entertaining. Engage in class discussions and read the text and an "A" is pretty much guaranteed.

She is great! I took her for self defense. This class was so much fun and I learned a lot. There is no text required for this class. She is a nice and funny woman who is truly passionate about personal safety. While it seemed like this class would be awkward, it turned out to be super fun and an easy A! Take her for self defense, you will be happy!

Kathy is pretty difficult when it comes to KSU 1101. Especially for the fact that it is a freshman seminar class. You have multiple quizzes and a lot of reading from the book. She is a very harsh grader, especially on papers. Other than those facts, she is very helpful and is a nice professor.

She is a very kind woman and wants all of her students to succeed, pretty funny at times too. I easily made an A in the class. Papers are easy. Almost everything is done online. Show up for the class and follow directions and you should be fine.
make sure you follow directions when writing papers. no tests but there is a midterm and a final. pay attention to what she is saying
She's a pretty cool teacher and funny at times. Most of her work are online and are pretty easy Quizzes are online no test only midterm and final.
shes real cool if u just show a little effort. she likes her male students.

As far as KSU seminars go, she is pretty difficult. She is a strict grader especially with grammar in your essays. She is definitely passionate about the course and wants to be there but don't expect extra credit or slack from her. If you actually want to make friends or have class discussions don't do hybrid, most classes were full lectures.

She is nice at first, until you need help from her. The class is decent for the most part, but if you don't understand something she gets sarcastic and has a smirk on her face, so you don't know if she's smiling or making fun of you. Would not recommend her if you like being able to talk to your professor when you have a question.
By far the nicest teacher I've met at Kennesaw. Is very sweet and understanding. Likes to talk and can easily get off topic, but makes the class enjoyable. Took the hybrid class, very easy A!
She grades way to hard for KSU 1101 class. This class is made to help you in other classes, but really it will bring down your GPA. If you have a choice, take another professor.
This professor is REALLY helpful and incredibly easy. As long as you study, take a few notes, and "read" a little....you'll do great.

Take Professor Lynn if you get the chance. I was in a learning community and took her for my KSU 1101 class. I was in the emergency preparedness group and she is so passionate about what she does and she is more than willing to help. Attendance is mandatory and there are a bunch of little assignment, but she is an easy grader. I came out with an 98

she rambles about things not relevant to the material. attendance is mandatory and there's a lot of pointless busy work she makes you do. She grades hard too so I would definitely try to get a different teacher.

DEFINITELY take her hybrid class if you have the opportunity- no offense but I would have dreaded going to her class twice a week. If you do hybrid all quizzes are online, and the assignments are also very easy (and she does not accept anything late). As long as you do ALL of your assignments and do them well you should end up with an A

Harsh grader, gives a lot of projects out at once. My lowest grade out of four classes was in her freshman seminar. Interesting class discussions and very passionate about teaching but overall much harder than a FYS class should be.

Not overall a good teacher. If you can, I would suggest that you try to get a better one. She is way to involved with information that really does not matter. There are other teachers that do not try to make this class more difficult than it should be.

Very nice, very considerate. JUST DO THE WORK! I had her as a hybrid class and she loved our class. Read the book and text book. Tests will be a breeze. Service learning project of at least 4 hours-get involved with Invisible Children! She does NOT accept late work! Do you work and study and you will do fine!

By far my favorite professor at KSU! Definitely take her if you can, I would in a heart beat if I could again! She is very helpful, enjoys teaching and is very clear on all assignments.. which are all relatively easy, too.
I really enjoyed her class. It was fun and interesting. I didn't have a high interest level in the class at the start but when we got into the semester, it was awesome!

SHE IS AWESOME! I absolutely LOVED her class this semester. Super easy online midterm and final. 2 really easy skills test. Only thing I didn't like was that it ended WAY too early. They should really consider making this a 18week course! Finished feeling like a real "Ninja" (if you take the course, you'll get the joke)! TAKE HER!

Very nice and helpful professor. She is passionate about what she is teaching which made a useless class bearable. There was a lot of work and assignments however i lead to some good discussions. In those she can tend to talk down to you if you do not share her views. Overall I really liked this Prof, however just a lot of work.
she is a nice lady....cares a lot about her subject. class itself was pretty pointless..she wasnt very clear with assignments..teaches a freshman class like a 4th year class
She is an AWESOME teacher and she really cares about her students.  If you can make room in your schedule for her do so!

Awesome professor.  The only reason that I enjoyed this class is because she made the stuff interesting.  Also had some funny discussions.  Do the work, don't turn anything in late, and you should have an A.  Also, be respectful to Professor Lynn.  She does not like it when people are rude or chat on facebook on laptops  as she teaches.

She is very passioante about teaching. She grades papers super easy- she gives reading homework but I never did it and I did just fine in the class. She has a lot of discussions. Overall I enjoyed her class because she is funny and nice. I would suggest her! :)
She loves teaching and she really enjoys discussion. I really enjoy her teaching even though the material is kind of lame. Come to class, do your homework, read the book, you will pass no problem.

AWESOME professor!! We have super interesting class discussions and I learned a lot about the college through this course. There's a lot of busy work, but it is not hard AT ALL. Just do the work, know the material in the book, go to every class, and pay attention. If you get anything lower than an A in this class, you are not ready for college.
Teacher that really likes teaching. Seemed like she liked what she is doing and as long as you did your work you are going to get an A.
She is a Wonderful person! This class is really kind of annoying but she is a good teacher. She is really passionate about what she teaches and is not flexible about late work.
She is nice and very passionate but hard. She is very strict but nice.  I turned out an 87 in the class and I had three or four missing assignments.  She makes you thing and I appreciate it.

This class was horrible, I suggest that you do not take this professor unless you have to. She is way to involved in material that matters so little. She takes the classes way to serioualy, nobody else I know has to do half the things that we had to do in this class.

dear freshman, RUN!!! do not take this class with her! she is nice and passionate but i have more work in her class than any other! just in this next week i have to do a 25 min presentation, 4 hours community service, and a 4 page research paper. WHAT?! my friends in other classes do not have this. SHE STRESSES ME OUT.

Prof Lynn was an excellent start to the KSU curriculum. She is full of passion, and it's contagious. You have to do a lot of work, but I disagree that it's pointless. Even as a senior, I still refer to some of these assignments. She makes you talk, but she's welcoming. Overall, I highly suggest her!

This call is NOT an easy A. She hands out tons of pointless assignments that you have to do. However, I really did learn a lot. Prof Lynn was extremely passionate about the topics and made you want to get involved on campus & know what's going on.
I made an A in her class.  She really cares about her students.  She is a very lenient grader.  If you just DO the work and go to class, you'll make an A.  Awesome lady.
Self defense was soooo much fun!!! i loved this class and at first you feel weird but you get over that very fast and learn to enjoy it! learned some cool techniques and had a blast doing it =]
She was a really good teacher! She gave 100% every class and it was never boring! Tests weren't difficult and the projects were easy!

Professor Lynn was funny, engaging and has a passion for her students.  Although I was not looking forward to the class (seemed like a waste of time initially) I learned a litle bit.  Tests were fairly easy.  Projects became a bit burdensome considering the class is not an academic class.  But all in all Professor Lynn made it fun and entertaining.

Even though I made an A, I didn't like the class. This teacher was very rude to us, her quizes were random, hard, and pointless. Midterm was hard, but the final was really easy. Lots of writing assignments. I was not expecting this much work from a freshman seminar course, so if you are looking for an easy class, look somewhere else!

She was alot of fun to have as a freshamn seminar teacher. I would take her class again! She explains everything in full and is helpful. Tests are easy as long as your prepared. She uses the workbook very often and gives grades back to you quickly. Lots of out of class activities, but it was a lot of fun. Laid back class.

So much fun, I was really dreading this class but she made it a great experience! She is helpful and fun! very easy if you actually do the work. her tests are a breeze and if you take her and dont love her then something is wrong with you!
Self Defense was fun...teaches street smarts and what to and not to do in situations Take her class you will enjoy it
She as great teacher. You can tell she loves teaching her class. She keeps the class interesting. The test are multiple choice. No trick questions! All-around GREAT teacher!

Great class- great teacher!  Self defense is important to know but hard to teach and she made it look effortless.  She was funny and kept things interesting-- always answered any questions you had. Great! Highly recommend it!
